message.body: Hi Juergen!
Hiya. (Only one E)
It's Friday. Any plans for the weekend
Ah, sorry autocorrect
Some. This evening there's a convivial potluck for a group i belong to. Sunday, though, $ planning & some shopping@home Depot
U?
I never trust spellchuckers [sic].
Today is my sister,s bday so we might go out for drinks
Sat probably just walking my dog and chillin out
Potluck sounds fun, what are you gonna bring ?
Yours sounds good. - Pick up some fruit or cookies Maybe down at the deli, they bake their own.
ce. Or maybe my son will cook something. He does pretty good stews & such.
My sister's is 7/1. She's out of state but coming up this way mid month, so yeah, I hadn't thought of it but I'll take her out for dinner. That'll be ni
Mid July that is, her birth month
What's your dog like?
She's sweet! A big lab mix, all black. 8 years old
She loves people and is super friendly
How old is your son?
Sounds like a real honey. - Oh, he's full grown, but he lives with me.
Does he cook a lot? Do you take turns?
And he's a better cook than I am. That's not saying much - I can do a mean omelet and not much more - but he's got a good feel for it. Stews, soups, & s
tir fry mostly.
No & no. Most of our dinners are separate & packaged. He does a LOT of take-in. :-(
Yeah I do that too much too. It's hard to cook when you're tired from work and are already hungry!
Ohhhh yeahhhhh... And I all too often stay later than I realize, and by the time I get home I'm too hungry, and too brain-fuddled with hunger, to cook.
Cooking is better though, I always end up regretting take out food
It's so expensive and usually not very healthy
He orders from some local places, I mean not like McDonalds. That's pretty decent stuff. But he ha pizza too often.
